lines.text: Goodness, what beautiful diamonds!
Goodness had nothing to do with it, dearie.
Maudie, do you believe in love at first sight?
I don't know, but it saves an awful lot of time.
Maudie, do you really think I could get rid of my inhibitions?
Why, sure. I got an old trunk you can put them in.
Hotcha!
If I was a pirate and I had you on my ship, I wouldn't throw you to the crew.
You'll happen to have some visitors one of these nights.
Heh, heh! Well, that's really funny! Will you do me a favor, Frankie?
Sure, Joe, anytime.

Will you tell Gaston and his mob the sooner they come around, the better I'll like it? You know these quiet evenings are getting on my nerves, and a little excitement would be as welcome as the flowers in May.
I'll tell him that, Joe.
Don't forget.
Leave it to me, and speaking of flowers, what sort would you prefer?
Oh, anything at all except pansies.
Your last wish will be fulfilled...
The way she sits, she stands out.
Oh, I get it. She's one of those standing and sitting ladies.
How dare you!
Ha-ha! Our old friend "How dare you."
'Keep off the grass' is written all over her.
I don't like being rousted around.
You gettin' to be one of those hypochondicrats?
Are you studying with that teacher, too?
You think you'd come over here if you didn't want me? This rough-housing the place is just a fancy way of putting it.
I'll bet ya ten bucks you never see her again.
You're on !
I'm on - and you're off your nut.
Where's Mr. Anton ?
Aw, he - he's around. Something I can do for you ?
Yes, tell me where he is.
Sit down. I'll see if I can find him.
I won't sit down.
Then stand up and I'll see if I can find him.
